Accounting Degrees and Certificates

Accounting is often referred to as the language of business. Whether you want to start your own business,get a business degree, or work in any business environment, it is important to understand accounting.

video
Associate Degree In Accounting

Why get an AS in Accounting?

1
Demand! Employment of accountants and auditors is projected to grow 10% from 2016 to 2026.
2
Infinite career growth with transferable skills.
3
Get a great paying job! Median pay in 2017 was $69, 350 ($33.34 per hour).
See Degree Requirements

Accounting Certificate Of Achievement

Employment opportunities include positions in general bookkeeping, accounts receivable/payable, payroll, income tax preparation, cost accounting and auditing.

See Certificate Requirements

Computerized Accounting Skills Certificate

Receive the skills and knowledge necessary to obtain entry-level accounting and other support positions in small and medium sized businesses which use computerized accounting systems.

See Certificate Requirements

Income Tax Preparer Skills Certificate

Enter the tax preparation field by receiving the education required by the California Tax Education Council to become a California Registered Tax Preparer.

See Certificate Requirements

Accounting for Government and Nonprofit Organizations Career Certificate

Become proficient in fund and not-for-profit accounting and perform basic accounting functions in a government and/or not-for-profit organization.

See Certificate Requirements
